trans-unit.source: Provides an object list adapter class for the Wireless Markup Language (WML) device adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The WML object list adapter uses secondary user interface (UI) features to render the control across multiple screens.
Instantiates an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlObjectListAdapter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A strongly typed reference to the associated control.
Called by a control to create a templated user interface (UI).
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
If <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, the instantiated templates bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request).
If <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>, the templates do not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to fill them in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event was handled.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called by a control when it receives a postback event notification, to check whether the event is adapter-specific.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.HandlePostBackEvent%2A>.
Name of the event.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event was handled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
the postback data is invalid.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> contains a command.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an object list control contains a command; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> contains a default command.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an object list control contains a default command; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a details view of an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> exists.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a details view of an object list control exists; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> contains a default command and no other commands.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an object list control contains a default command and no other commands; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlControlAdapter.SecondaryUIMode*> for the control, and calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.PreShowItemCommands*> method on its <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlObjectListAdapter.Control*>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.EventArgs> for the event.
Generates the target-specific markup for the control to which the control adapter is attached, using the provided writer.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer to receive output.
Renders the details of the specified item.
This API is obsolete.

The text writer.
The specified item.
Renders the menu of commands for the specified item.

The specified item.

For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> that indicates whether the list must be rendered as a table.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method can be overridden in order to change the manner in which the list view is rendered.
> [!NOTE] > Even if the ShouldRenderAsTable method returns `true`, the target device might not support tables, in which case the list view will not be rendered as a table.

The ShouldRenderAsTable method returns a `Boolean` that indicates whether the specified table will fit on the target device screen, whereas the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.Tables%2A> (inherited from <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities>) of the <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities> class returns a `Boolean` that indicates whether the device supports tables at all.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the list must be rendered as a table; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
